intro: Myrsine korthalsii, commonly known as the African myrsine, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface. It produces small white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals.
